title.narrative: SECTORAL INFO. SYSTEMS ON CHILD RIGHTS

description.narrative: National sectoral information systems have access to and capacity for incorporating disaggregated data on issues pertaining to child rights in the country, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Data And Child Protection, Education â€“ General, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys progressively utilise well governed and accountable child rights coordination and monitoring systems and have equitable access to justice, by 2022.

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National sectoral information systems have access to and capacity for incorporating disaggregated data on issues pertaining tochild rights in the country

description.narrative: National authorities have continued to increase their capacity to produce consolidated and disaggregated data on child rights with a particular for focus on strengthening administrative data collection in the social welfare, education and health sector. The partnership with MONSTAT continued over the digitalization of the SILC survey in order to make better use of their available data for socal welfare policy and practise. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of child-rights-based indicators incorporated in Social Welfare Information System (SWIS)(46500)
Availability of data on children participating in justice processes in Judicial Information System (PRIS)(46501)

baseline.value: Data on children in conflict with the law available

target.value: 2021:Data on all children participating in justice processes available

actual.value: 2021:Establishment and operationalization of the New Judicial Information delayed including indicators on children in contact with the law.
